com.fluidops.iwb.provider

Class ProviderUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.iwb.provider.ProviderUtils

  • public class ProviderUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenience methods for statement creation and cleansing, to be used by providers.

    msc

        object - the statement's object
        Returns:

                                          org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                                          org.openrdf.model.Value object)
        Creates a statement, basically wrapping Sesame's value factory. The object in subject position is converted to a URI based on its toString() method.
        Parameters:
        subjectObj - the object to be converted to the subject URI
        predicate - the statement's predicate
        object - the statement's object
        Returns:
        the created statement or null if one of the parameters was null

                                             org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                                             java.lang.Object objectObj)
        Creates a statement, basically wrapping Sesame's value factory. The objects in subject and object position are converted to a URI based on their toString() methods.
        Parameters:
        subjectObj - the object to be converted to the subject URI
        predicate - the statement's predicate
        objectObj - the object to be converted to the object URI
        Returns:
        the created statement or null if one of the parameters was null

                                             java.lang.Object objectObj)
        Creates a statement, basically wrapping Sesame's value factory. The object in object position is converted to a URI based on its toString() method.
        Parameters:
        subject - the statements subject
        predicate - the statement's predicate
        objectObj - the object to be converted to the object URI
        Returns:
        the created statement or null if one of the parameters was null

      • createLiteralStatement

        public static org.openrdf.model.Statement createLiteralStatement(java.lang.Object subjectObj,
                                                 org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                                                 java.lang.Object objectObj)
        Creates a statement where (1) for the subject string a URI is guessed according to internal guessing mechanisms and (2) the literal will become a typed literal statement based on a mapping between java object types and xsd datatypes, where string literals remain untyped. This means that for objects like Integer, Double, etc., corresponding xsd datatypes are used. In case the object is a complex object, toString() is used to get a string representation. Returns null if casting of the object fails.
        Parameters:
        subjectObj - the object whose string representation will be converted to the subject URI
        predicate - the predicate of the triple to be created
        objectObj - the object whose string representation will be converted to the object literal
        Returns:
        the statement or null if statement creation failed

      • createLiteralStatement

        public static org.openrdf.model.Statement createLiteralStatement(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                                                 org.openrdf.model.URI predicate,
                                                 java.lang.Object objectObj)
        Creates a typed literal statement based on a mapping between java object types and xsd datatypes, where string literals remain untyped. This means that for objects like Integer, Double, etc., corresponding xsd datatypes are used. In case the object is a complex object, toString() is used to get a string representation. Returns null if casting of the object fails.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of the triple to be created
        predicate - the predicate of the triple to be created
        objectObj - the object whose string representation will be converted to the object literal
        Returns:
        the statement or null if statement creation failed

      • createDefaultRdfStatements

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> createDefaultRdfStatements(java.lang.Object subjectObj,
                                                                     org.openrdf.model.URI type,
                                                                     java.lang.String label,
                                                                     java.lang.String comment)
        Creates default RDF vocabulary information for the subject (where the subject's URI is derived from the object's toString() method), i.e. associating an rdf:type, rdfs:label, and rdfs:comment. All parameters except the subject may be null (in which case the statement is not written).
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject for which to write the information
        type - the type of the subject (may be null)
        label - the label of the subject (may be null)
        comment - the comment associated with the subject (may be null)
        Returns:
        up to three statements containing the statement's type, label, and comment; never null

      • createDefaultRdfStatements

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> createDefaultRdfStatements(org.openrdf.model.Resource subject,
                                                                     org.openrdf.model.URI type,
                                                                     java.lang.String label,
                                                                     java.lang.String comment)
        Creates default RDF vocabulary information for the subject, i.e. associating an rdf:type, rdfs:label, and rdfs:comment. All parameters except the subject may be null (in which case the statement is not written).
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject for which to write the information
        type - the type of the subject (may be null)
        label - the label of the subject (may be null)
        comment - the comment associated with the subject (may be null)
        Returns:
        up to three statements containing the statement's type, label, and comment; never null

      • filterStatements

                                                           ProviderUtils.StatementFilter filter)
        Filters a list of statements with a single of filters. The statements must not contain null values in their positions.
        Parameters:

        filterList - the list of filters (may be null or empty)
        Returns:
        the filtered list of statement

      • filterStatements

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> filterStatements(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                                           ProviderUtils.StatementFilterList filterList)
        Filters a list of statements with a list of filters. The statements must not contain null values in their positions.
        Parameters:
        stmts - the statements to be filtered
        filterList - the list of filters (may be null or empty)
        Returns:
        the filtered list of statement

      • filterStatements

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> filterStatements(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts,
                                                           boolean filterNullStatements,
                                                           boolean filterInvalidStatements,
                                                           ProviderUtils.StatementFilterList filterList)
        Generic filter method having the capabilities to (1) make a list of statements null-free, (2) assert that the statements contain valid URIs, (3) applies a list of user-defined filters. The three mechanisms can be arbitrarily combined, with the exception that filtering with user-defined filters implicitly assumes that the statements do not contain null values in their positions. However, when setting the flag to make the statements null-free, null statements are filtered away prior to applying the user-defined filters.
        Parameters:
        stmts - the statements to be filtered
        filterNullStatements - flag to filter away statements with null in any position
        filterInvalidStatements - flag filter away statements with invalid RDF primitives in any position
        additionalFilter - additional filter specification
        Returns:
        the filtered list of statement, may be null

      • filterNullStatements

        public static java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> filterNullStatements(java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> stmts)
        Removes null values and statements containing null values in their positions from a list of statements.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the filtered list of statement

      • passesThroughFilter

        public static boolean passesThroughFilter(org.openrdf.model.Statement stmt,
                          ProviderUtils.StatementFilter filter)
        Checks whether a statement passes through a filter. The statement must be a valid RDF statement, containing no null values; in case it contains any null values, false is returned.
        Parameters:
        stmt - the statement to be filtered
        filter - the ProviderUtils.StatementFilter to be applied
        Returns:
        true iff the statement passes through the filter

      • objectToTypedLiteral

        public static org.openrdf.model.Literal objectToTypedLiteral(java.lang.Object object)
        Converts a java object to a typed literal, based on a mapping between java datatypes and XSD datatypes. String literals are not typed. The same applies to objects of unknown types, where we simply use toString() to serialize the object to RDF.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be converted to a literal
        Returns:
        the literal or null, if conversion fails

      • objectAsUri

        public static org.openrdf.model.URI objectAsUri(java.lang.Object object)
        Creates a valid URI for the given object, assuming that the object's string representation represents a valid URI. This essentially wraps the ValueFactory.createUri() method and, in addition, replaces non-valid URI characters by underscores. May return null if the object is empty, null, or if the object's string representation does not represent a structurally valid URI (e.g., if the protocol identifier is missing).

      • objectToUri

        public static org.openrdf.model.URI objectToUri(java.lang.Object object)
        Creates a valid URI for the given object using the objects toString() method, based on our internal URI guessing mechanisms. This means, the input's string representation can be either a bare string Person1, a prefixed string link "foaf:Person", or a full URI like "". Does not return null except in case that object==null or object.toString()==null.

      • objectToURIInNamespace

        public static org.openrdf.model.URI objectToURIInNamespace(java.lang.String namespace,
                                           java.lang.Object object)
        Converts an object to a literal in the specified namespace based on the object's toString() method. The namespace must not be null. The URI is composed by concatenating the namespace and the objects string representation, thereby making sure that no non-URI-compatible characters are replaced by an underscore character. The method returns null in the following cases: (i) object==null || object.toString()==null (ii) namespace==null (iii) namespace+object.toString() is structurally not a valid URI. In particular, if a URI is generated this URI is a valid URI.

      • freshBlankNode

        public static org.openrdf.model.BNode freshBlankNode()
        Creates a fresh blank node.

      • uriToQueryString

        public static java.lang.String uriToQueryString(org.openrdf.model.URI u)
        Wraps a URI to a string, e.g. to be used inside a SPARQL query.

        public static void appendGraphQueryResultToListAndClose(org.openrdf.query.GraphQueryResult result,
                                        java.util.List<org.openrdf.model.Statement> res)
        Appends a graph query result to a list of statements and closes the iterator.
        Parameters:
        iterator - the result iterator
        res - the list where to append the statements
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - in case someting goes wrong
